laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked asymmetric enlargement and hypervascularity of the right testicle; hypoechoic region in the mediastinum testis likely related to edema due to infection or inflammation; enlarged and hypervascular epididymis; associated complex hydrocele with septations and internal debris on the right side.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Right testicular volume increased from approximately 19 ml to approximately 33 ml over 6 weeks, hypoechoic region increased in size, multiple new nonspecific hypoechoic areas scattered throughout the remaining testicular parenchyma.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Yellow, clear urine, specific gravity 1.011 (1.001 to 1.035), pH 6.0 (5.0 to 9.0), no evidence of leukocyte esterase or occult blood.
All four mycobacterial cultures of the urine grew M. tuberculosis.
